title: Workshop on Information Technology-Based Teaching-Learning Style Analysis Methods

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental teaching-learning theories and experience with information technology applications
context.additional_context: A hands-on course applying three-dimensional analysis (network utilization, collaborative methodologies, independence levels) to help pre-service teachers effectively integrate IT into elementary science instruction

learning_goals: Information technology-integrated teaching-learning styles can be diagnosed using a three-dimensional analysis framework (network/collaboration/independence)
Digital teaching-learning scenarios suitable for elementary science classes can be designed using mobile devices

Learners analyze provided K-12 classroom data (3-class samples) to propose at least one tailored instructional strategy per VARK learning style (visual, auditory, reading/writing, kinesthetic). They achieve a rating of "average" or higher in at least four of five peer evaluation rubric items.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
